text: The Berlayer Creek has its origin near Depot Road and flows as a small stream between Alexandra Road and the Gilmore Baracks. At the Labrador MRT it gains more flow but also attraction with its attractive Boardwalk all the way down to the Keppel Harbour. A unique place where we can experience the tide with fresh water flowing towards the sea but with the rising tide the seawater flows upstream! The flora, bushes and trees are adapted to this harsh conditions.
Interesting place to visit the nature and get to see some wildlife and fisheries.
Overlooked stretch of mangrove.  Wildlife potential is very high.  Photo by Raymond Siew.
A short mangrove broadwalk that will lead you to Labrador Park. Easily accessible via Labrador MRT Stn
Nice place for a quiet walk. Best to start from Labrador Park MRT station.
